case_vignette: A 42-year-old male with a history of ulcerative colitis presents to the emergency room with four-day history of nausea, bloody diarrhea, and abdominal pain. He is on medical management with 5-aminosalicylic acid (5 ASA). Examination shows an ill appearing man with a tense, tympanitic abdominal exam. He is unable to be fully examined due to the abdominal pain. Vitals are T 38.2 C, HR 102 bpm BP 133/92 mmHg,2 RR 20 bpm, and O2 Sat 100% on room air. In the ED an abdominal radiograph is shown in Figure A.
question: Which  is the diagnosis?
